page.title: 05REVIVED LOCAL CUSTOMS
page.content: In Callington Maypole dancing,using a locally felled pine tree,has taken place since 1972.Dancers are girls between 5 & 10 years old.They dance in procession to Chyvarhas Home where they perform the Plait & the Barber's Pole as part of Callington's May Day celebrations.A fund_raising May Day was revived in Harrowbarrow 4 years ago.In 1929 Callington Old Cornwall Society revived the custom of lighting a Midsummer's Eve Bonfire on Kit Hill, the last in a chain of 80 beacons in Cornwall.The ceremony proceeds in Cornish and English,and the local president holds the Cornish flag.The Lady of the Flowers casts a bunch of wild flowers bound with green,blue,red & yellow _ colours signifying strength,wisdom,love and sacrifice _ into the fire.
